characters.name: Gary Winship
characters.title: Regional Sales Manager | Kettering & Surrounding Areas | Food Enthusiast
characters.tagline: Passionate about people, process, and a proper breakfast.
characters.bio: 20+ years in regional sales. I've driven every B-road in the East Midlands and eaten in places that don't have a TripAdvisor page yet. That's not a complaint ‚Äî that's a flex. If you want to talk pipeline, territory management, or where to get the best pork dripping sandwich in Northamptonshire, my inbox is always open.

characters.name: Brad Hustle
characters.title: Serial Entrepreneur | Founder @ VelocityMindset | Helping YOU unlock your potential üöÄ
characters.tagline: 3x founder. Infinite learner. DM me 'READY' to find out more.
characters.bio: I've failed forward three times and I'm not stopping. FailFast (2019-2020). GrindStack (2021-2022). DisruptLocal (2022-2023). Each one a masterclass in resilience. Now I channel everything into VelocityMindset ‚Äî the programme that teaches you what school never did. Join 12 students who are already on the journey. The Hustle Blueprint: ¬£197. Link in bio.

characters.name: Derek Leanin
characters.title: Motivational Strategist | Speaker | Helping Leaders Think Different
characters.tagline: Every setback is a setup. Every failure is a foundation.
characters.bio: I believe the world's greatest lessons come not from boardrooms or business schools, but from life itself. I share those lessons here. Some weeks I post every day. Some weeks, life teaches me something so profound I need to sit with it. Follow along. You won't regret it.

characters.name: Caroline Stakeholder
characters.title: Connector | Amplifier | Human | Change Advocate
characters.tagline: I see you. I hear you. I share your content.
characters.bio: Some people create. Some people connect. I do both, but mainly the second one. If you've posted something that moved me ‚Äî and a lot of things move me ‚Äî you'll know about it. This space is about amplification, community, and showing up. Every. Single. Day.

characters.name: Nigel Boateng-Walsh
characters.title: Property Investor | Entrepreneur | Founder @ NB-W Capital | Mindset Coach
characters.tagline: Building generational wealth one asset at a time. üè†
characters.bio: I didn't come from money. I came from Croydon. Now I run a property portfolio across two counties and coach other founders on the mindset shift that changes everything. My events sell out. My properties rent out. My methods work. If you're ready to build something real ‚Äî let's talk.

characters.name: Priya Bandwidth
characters.title: Thought Leader | Keynote Speaker | Founder @ The Bandwidth Brief Newsletter
characters.tagline: The future isn't coming. It's already here. Are you ready?
characters.bio: I speak at conferences. I write the newsletter. I am writing the book (2025, I mean it this time). I have been called a visionary by people who heard me speak. I travel for work a lot and document this on here because I think it's important for people to see that success looks like a departure lounge.

posts.author: gary-winship
posts.text:
People talk about Greggs like it's the pinnacle of the casual dining experience.

I was in a layby outside Corby at 7:15 this morning. There's a van there ‚Äî no sign, no social media presence, no Google listing. Run by a man called Trevor. Trevor does a pork dripping sandwich on white bread that would make your knees buckle.

I'll be circlejerking this later because some of you need to know about Trevor.

Greggs. Don't make me laugh.

comments.author: caroline-stakeholder
comments.text: This. üôå Couldn't have said it better myself. The hidden gems are always off the beaten track.

comments.author: brad-hustle
comments.text: Love this Gary. The best opportunities are always where nobody else is looking. Same applies to business. üöÄ

posts.author: brad-hustle
posts.text:
4:47am.

Dark outside.

Everyone else is asleep.

I am not everyone else.

Year one of VelocityMindset, I had nothing. No funding. No team. No traction. Just a laptop, a dream, and an absolute refusal to accept the narrative society had written for me.

Year two? I have 12 students. A Notion template. And a clearer vision than I have ever had.

The Hustle Blueprint isn't for everyone. It's for the ones who are awake at 4:47.

Are you awake?

DM me 'READY' to find out more. üöÄ

comments.author: derek-leanin
comments.text: The ones who get up before the sun are the ones who build the future. Powerful stuff Brad.

comments.author: caroline-stakeholder
comments.text: This. üôå

posts.author: derek-leanin
posts.text:
I once watched a pigeon eat a discarded chip in a Lidl car park in Wolverhampton.

It didn't ask for permission.

It didn't wait for the chip to be offered.

It saw the chip. It assessed the chip. It took the chip.

That pigeon's name was Jeff Bezos.

Stop waiting to be handed the chip.

Take the chip.

‚ôªÔ∏è Repost if this moved you.

comments.author: caroline-stakeholder
comments.text: Couldn't have said it better. The chip is out there for all of us. We just have to want it enough. üôå

comments.author: brad-hustle
comments.text: Sending this to my entire cohort RIGHT NOW. Derek you are the real deal mate.

comments.author: gary-winship
comments.text: Good stuff Derek. Though I will say, Lidl car parks are underrated for a quick bite. The bakery section is decent first thing.

posts.author: nigel-founder
posts.text:
I'm not going to lie to you.

Adding a ¬£1.2m property to the portfolio last quarter nearly broke me.

The due diligence. The negotiation. The sleepless nights questioning every decision. My body was telling me to stop. I kept going.

Because that's what builders do.

The asset is now generating ¬£1,450 a month. The stress was temporary. The asset is permanent.

This is what I teach at my Founder Mornings events. The body will lie to you. The spreadsheet will not.

Next event: 14th March, Guildford. Link in bio. üè†

comments.author: brad-hustle
comments.text: Inspiration Nigel. The body is just the mind's most vocal critic. üî•

comments.author: derek-leanin
comments.text: I once met a man who stopped at the bottom of Everest because his legs hurt. Nobody remembers his name.

posts.author: priya-bandwidth
posts.text:
Landed.

Dubai.

Third time this year.

Every time I come here I'm reminded that the future isn't a destination.

It's a posture.

Speaking tomorrow at the GrowthForward MENA Summit to 200+ founders, operators, and builders about what I'm calling The Bandwidth Shift.

I won't spoil it here.

But if you've been following along, you already know.

The Bandwidth Brief ‚Äî issue 34 ‚Äî drops Thursday. 34 issues. Still going. ‚úàÔ∏è

#ThoughtLeadership #FutureOfWork #Dubai #Grateful

comments.author: caroline-stakeholder
comments.text: This. The future is absolutely a posture. Couldn't agree more Priya. Safe travels! üôå

comments.author: derek-leanin
comments.text: The best views are always from departure gates and mountain tops. You're doing both Priya (metaphorically).

posts.author: caroline-stakeholder
posts.text:
Just seen this from Brad Hustle and I couldn't NOT share it.

I mean ‚Äî could I have said this better myself? Honestly, probably not. So I won't try.

Actually, I will just say: the people who show up before sunrise are the architects of their own future. The ones who sleep in are the tenants. That's not me being harsh. That's just mathematics.

Anyway. Brad. This. üôå

[Resharing: Brad Hustle ‚Äî 4:47am post]

comments.author: brad-hustle
comments.text: Caroline you are an absolute champion. This community üôè

posts.author: nigel-founder
posts.text:
Before and after.

This one took 6 weeks. Bought at auction. Previous owner had let it go a bit.

We came in, stripped it back, fresh plaster, full repaint throughout (Dulux Polished Pebble ‚Äî clients always ask), new carpets from Carpet Right, and a kitchen from B&Q that photographs absolutely beautifully.

On the market Friday. Already had three enquiries.

This is what I mean when I say ANYONE can do this. You just need the eye, the team, and the discipline to walk away from the shortcuts.

Ask me about my next Founder Morning. üè†‚ú®

comments.author: caroline-stakeholder
comments.text: The transformation is incredible Nigel. You have such an eye for this. üôå

comments.author: gary-winship
comments.text: Solid work Nigel. I drive past some of those auction places on my rounds. Good to know what to look for.

posts.author: gary-winship
posts.headline: What a petrol station outside Northampton taught me about leadership
posts.excerpt: It was a Tuesday. I was between calls. The satnav had taken me off the A43 onto a road I didn't recognise. What happened next changed how I think about everything.
posts.body:
It was a Tuesday. I was between calls ‚Äî Daventry to Wellingborough, a route I could drive in my sleep. The satnav took me off the A43 onto a B-road I didn't recognise. Fine. I've driven worse.

About four miles in, I spotted it. Forecourt. Two pumps. A small shop with a handwritten sign in the window: HOT FOOD. Not a chain. Not a brand. Just a sign and a possibility.

I pulled in.

The woman behind the counter ‚Äî Margaret, as it turned out ‚Äî had been running this place for 31 years. Her father had run it before her. The sausage roll she sold me was warm, properly seasoned, and wrapped in a paper bag with no logo on it. Just a bag. Just a sausage roll.

And I thought: this is leadership.

Not the TED Talk version. Not the LinkedIn version. The real version. Showing up. Doing the thing. Not needing a brand or a following or a course to sell.

Margaret doesn't have a newsletter. Margaret doesn't post at 4:47am. Margaret has been there for 31 years with a sign that says HOT FOOD, and that sign has never lied.

I drove away thinking about all the Margarets out there. The ones doing the work without the noise.

Greggs could never.

comments.author: derek-leanin
comments.text: Margaret is all of us. We are all Margaret. Until we become something more than Margaret. Powerful piece Gary.

comments.author: caroline-stakeholder
comments.text: I cried a little bit at this. Couldn't have said it better. Sharing immediately. This. üôå

comments.author: priya-bandwidth
comments.text: The Margarets are the ones who never needed a rebrand. There's a newsletter issue in this Gary.

posts.author: brad-hustle
posts.headline: I lost everything at 22. Here's what it taught me about winning.
posts.excerpt: FailFast was my first company. We had a deck, a domain name, and a dream. Then we had nothing. This is the story I've never fully told before (I've told it several times but not like this).
posts.body:
Let me take you back to 2019.

I was 20 years old. I had a laptop, a WeWork day pass, and an idea that I genuinely believed was going to change the logistics sector. FailFast was born.

What was FailFast? It was an app. An app that connected local couriers with small businesses using proprietary route optimisation. We had a deck. We had a domain. We had a Slack workspace with four people in it.

We did not have a product. We did not have customers. We did not have revenue. These felt like details.

Eighteen months later, FailFast was dead.

But here's what I gained:

1. I learned that a deck is not a business.
2. I learned that a Slack workspace is not a team.
3. I learned that WeWork day passes are very expensive over eighteen months.

And most importantly: I learned that failure is not the opposite of success. Failure is the curriculum.

GrindStack came next (2021). Then DisruptLocal (2022). Each one a new lesson. Each one a new chapter in the book I am writing mentally every single day.

Now there is VelocityMindset. And it is different. I can feel it.

I have 12 students enrolled in The Hustle Blueprint. Twelve people who decided that the traditional path wasn't for them. Twelve people who are awake at 4:47am.

Are you ready to be the thirteenth?

DM me 'READY'.

comments.author: derek-leanin
comments.text: Every empire was built on a foundation of ruins. Yours is coming Brad.

comments.author: caroline-stakeholder
comments.text: The honesty here is incredible. Couldn't have been more vulnerable if you tried. This. This. This. üôå

posts.author: derek-leanin
posts.text:
In 1987, a young boy in a small town in Ohio couldn't afford shoes for school.

A teacher noticed. She didn't say anything. She just left a pair outside his locker the next morning.

That boy never forgot.

That boy grew up.

That boy is now responsible for the logistics operations of one of the largest fulfilment networks in the world, where conditions for workers are, by certain accounts, quite difficult.

But the shoes. The shoes mattered.

Be the teacher.

‚ôªÔ∏è Repost if this resonated.

comments.author: caroline-stakeholder
comments.text: Be the teacher. BE THE TEACHER. I am screenshotting this immediately. üôå

comments.author: nigel-founder
comments.text: Powerful Derek. The details are what build the foundation. Speaking of foundations ‚Äî event on 14th March if you're interested mate üëä

jobs.title: Sales Executive (Driven & Hungry Individuals Only)
jobs.location: Slough, Berkshire (Hybrid ‚Äî min. 4 days in office)
jobs.description:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a driven sales professional to join our growing team at Synergise Solutions. You will be responsible for generating leads, managing a pipeline, and hitting targets in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

The right candidate will be hungry, resilient, and not afraid to pick up the phone. We're not looking for clock-watchers.

Benefits include: 28 days holiday (including bank holidays), pension (statutory), free parking (limited spaces, first come first served), casual Friday (smart casual), kitchen with Nespresso machine.
jobs.smallPrint: *Uncapped commission subject to hitting base target. Base target reviewed quarterly. Commission structure under review.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Executive ‚Äî Future Star Programme
jobs.description:
Leverage & Grow is looking for a passionate and curious Digital Marketing Executive to join our award-winning* team. This is an entry-level role with genuine progression potential for the right person.

You will be supporting the marketing team with social media scheduling, email campaigns, reporting, and general marketing administration. You will also be expected to attend monthly all-hands meetings and contribute to our culture programme.

The ideal candidate will have: a degree (any discipline), 1-2 years' relevant experience (unpaid internships count), strong attention to detail, a passion for brands, and a can-do attitude.
jobs.smallPrint: *Self-nominated award, 2023 West Midlands Business Excellence shortlist.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.location: Remote (UK only ‚Äî must be able to attend London office quarterly)
jobs.description:
PivotCore Technologies is scaling rapidly and we need a Customer Success Manager to help us retain and grow our client base. You'll be the primary point of contact for a portfolio of 80‚Äì120 accounts, responsible for onboarding, QBRs, renewals, and upsell conversations.

This is a high-impact role with visibility at senior leadership level. We're a fast-moving team and we expect our CSMs to move fast with us. There's no playbook ‚Äî you'll be writing it.

We offer: flexible working (core hours 9‚Äì6), 25 days holiday, private health (after 2 years), and a genuine seat at the table.
jobs.smallPrint: Salary: competitive. We don't post a range because every candidate is different. Please include your current salary in your application.

jobs.title: EXCITING OPPORTUNITY ‚Äî Brand Ambassador (Commission Only)
jobs.salary: Uncapped earnings ‚Äî you set the ceiling! üí∞
jobs.description:
Are you passionate about health, wellness, and building a community around things that matter? Do you want to be your own boss and work the hours that suit YOUR lifestyle?

Apex Wellness Partners is looking for motivated Brand Ambassadors to share our range of premium wellness products with their existing network. No experience necessary ‚Äî just enthusiasm and a strong social media presence.

This is NOT a job. This is a business opportunity. You are the CEO of your own journey.

Initial starter kit required (¬£149 + VAT). Earnings from referrals and downline activity.
jobs.smallPrint: Average annual earnings of active Brand Ambassadors: ¬£612. 73% of participants earn less than the cost of the starter kit.
